result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wakim Leon Bryant Jr

records.addlTxt: CASE TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR GLOBAL RESOLUTION.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant Jr in Court, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in Court for Wakim Leon Bryant Jr.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr m in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defendant also has Case 22CF1234 pending in Branch 46. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO CASE 22CM1381: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered CASE 22CM1381 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing in Case 22CF1234.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel recently appointed and requests additional time. Defenes counsel informed the Court that the defendant has pending matter 22CF1234 in Branch 46 that may resolve globally.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Wakim Leon Bryant appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wakim Leon Bryant not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 06-17-2022. Defendant is in custody at HOC.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/2022 @1:30p
